definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: The judge played bridge in the lodge with the budgeter last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚法官和預算員在門房裏打過橋牌。

sentences.english: My counsel asked the doorkeeper if he, too, hadn't smoked.
sentences.chinese: 這時，我的律師問門房是否和我一道抽菸了。

sentences.english: LaoJiangHu ghost uncle, is before the sword, is now home TiTouJiang descends to the porter.
sentences.chinese: 老江湖鬼叔，以前是刀家的門房，現已淪落爲剃頭匠。

sentences.english: I enquired at the porters' lodge. A middle-aged man with a kindly face came forward.
sentences.chinese: 我到門房去打聽，一位和藹善良的中年人走上前來。

sentences.english: After which the doorkeeper went back to his seat.
sentences.chinese: 門房回到他的座位上去。

sentences.english: He is the son of Quebec actor Manuel Tadros.
sentences.chinese: 我看演員表上演的是門房，到底哪位是他爸？

sentences.english: Guests pass through a gatehouse and then travel down a path that leads to a lodge, the main home and a guest dwelling.
sentences.chinese: 客人從門房穿過，然後通過一條小路到達主人的居所。

sentences.english: The concièrge closed the door, leaving Madame Danglars in the street.
sentences.chinese: 那門房關上門，讓騰格拉爾夫人站在街上。

sentences.english: When does the porter open that door?
sentences.chinese: 什麼時候門房纔開那扇門呢？

sentences.english: The porter had to force the window open every morning.
sentences.chinese: 每天早晨門房只好用力硬把窗戶打開。

sentences.english: Family and children's activities can be arranged through the concierge.
sentences.chinese: 家庭及孩子們的活動均由門房組織策劃。

sentences.english: In the interior, beyond the barricades, the wine-shops and porters' lodges were converted into guard-houses.
sentences.chinese: 在一些街壘的內部，那些酒廳和門房都變成了警衛室。
